Bernie Sanders quote!): Now, Republicans not only have made Mr. Ryan chairman of the House Budget Committee, but on Tuesday the House is expected to vote to give him unprecedented powers to force spending cuts for the current fiscal year. That authority will allow Mr. Ryan to act unilaterally in setting an overall spending level for the rest of the year, a job usually handled by his full panel.... "Up until this point, the Republican leadership has been vague about what federal programs they want to cut, said Sen. Bernie Sanders , a Vermont independent who caucuses with Democrats. "On the other hand, Congressman Ryan has been very clear on this subject."" If the picture still isn't clear enough,
